snippet: The chief executive of the Japanese auto supplier stopped short of saying the company would comply with the demand of United States regulators.
abstract: Japanese auto supplier Takata takes no action in response to demand by National Highway Traffic Safety Admin for expansion of recall of defective airbags; company releases statement saying it feels public safety is best served if it continues focusing recall in regions of high humidity; NHTSA had threatened further legal action and potential penalties if recall is not expanded.

byline.contributor: Hiroko Tabuchi and Aaron Kessler contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The chief executive of the Japanese auto supplier stopped short of saying the company would comply with the demand of United States regulators.

headline.main: Takata Takes No Action on Demand to Expand Recall of Faulty Airbags
headline.print_headline: Takata Takes No Action on U.S. Recall Demand
